course_title: Law and Religion in Practice and Legal Advocacy: Law and Religion
course_description: This course would complement the current offerings Law and Religion: Theories, Methods, and  Approaches, which provides an introduction to the academic study of law and religion, and First Amendment: Religious Freedom, which provides the constitutional foundation for religion's special treatment under U.S. law. The course will provide students with an opportunity to develop working knowledge of the variety of practice areas and skills that are valuable either when pursuing law and religion as an area of practice or when confronted with unexpected encounters with religion in legal practice.
